title: Cassiopeia QoL balance suggestions.
body:
After playing a few games of new Cass I've really began to start noticing some of Cass's QoL issues that could really use a change. Some of these have been said before but I'm just sort of organizing some of them into one cohesive thread. I'd like to see maybe one or 2 of these be looked if possible.

**Auto attack animation:**
-Cass's auto attack animation is sooooo incredibly slooooooooowwwww. When I'm trying to last hit with my autos I feel so vulnerable and its feels so blegh. I really would love it if Riot could increase the travel speed of Cass's autos and reduce the animation time.

**Having to stand still while casting Noxious blast:**
-Now whether this is done for the sake of balance or whether its unintentional I feel like this would be an amazing change to Cass. If its for the sake of balance though I would understand. Though I will say if Syndra can cast her Q while continuing motion then why cant Cass. Just something to think about.

**Having to stand still while casting Twin Fang:**
-Ok this is something that needs to change. Honestly. Like I don't mind THAT MUCH that I have to stand still while casting Q but when I'm trying to kite backwards with my E I feel like its almost impossible sometimes to position myself properly and continue to deal damage. If Cass really is this APC markmenesque carry that is meant to kite around fights and while lacking any sort of mobility outside of her Q movement speed boost, then I feel its only fair that she retain her mobility when casting her twin fang. Call me crazy but in this league of insane mobility assassins and bruisers I don't think its too much to ask to be able to continue my movement away from them without having to stop while kiting. Like its one thing for an ADC to do it with the click of a mouse, its a whole nother for Cass since she has to first off land her Q(while standing still I might add) and then having to nail them with her E's.

This last one I've been told has been discussed already and most likely is already in the works just stating it for the lolz basically and to keep everything centralized.
**Clearer particle effects on her poisons:**
-Basically just make her poisons easier to notice in big teamfights so she can use twin fang properly and effectively, blah blah yadda yadda.

So basically these are a few QoL concerns I have, if anyone agrees with these I'd love to hear. If you don't you can go sit in the corner with Teemo.(lol jk) But seriously if you don't agree pls tell me why.

Edit: After playing around with new Cass I almost wanna say i would prefer the Q change over the E change but I couldn't tell you. Both would just make everything about everything so much nicer with Cass.

replies.body: Trying to QoL the current iteration of Cass is useless, because no amount of power or ease of use will make the playstyle Stashu is trying to push rewarding and fun.

Me: *checks opgg profile*
*mfw you haven't even played new Cass since the update*
:^(

I don't have to in order to read.

He did nothing to address the actual problems, so nothing about my opinion is going to change.

> [{quoted}](name=Serpents Embrace,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WPsf4IHw,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2014-12-12T01:39:02.899+0000)
> I don't have to in order to read.
> 
> He did nothing to address the actual problems, so nothing about my opinion is going to change.

How do you possibly know that unless you play it though? This is like a food critic judging a new dish before having tried it.

The "problem" you go around talking about constantly is that you want old Cass back. Its not going to happen. Pick a better main and username if you are upset.

No. The problems with the rework were listed clearly by the community, and by Stashu. And then changes come out that not only fail to address the issues, they exacerbate it. If the E-focused playstyle is causing issues with the majority of the champion's player base - changing the E to be more integral to the kit isn't the right move and *won't* fix anything.

And furthermore, the **problem** I have isn't that I want a simple revert. Don't **presume** to tell me what it is I want. The only thing that's **truly important** in this entire process is Cassiopeia's identity. One that hinges on a personality and goal fantasy that Stashu has practically admitted and definitely shown he has **no idea** what either is.

> The only thing that's **truly important** in this entire process is Cassiopeia's identity. One that hinges on a personality and goal fantasy that Stashu has practically admitted and definitely shown he has **no idea** what either is.

{{item:2054}} +1
Try playing it. Then get back to me. Your opinion feels very shallow until then.

Played it.

Still think the rework needs to be sent to the gallows.

What a surprise.

#BecauseBotGamesAreAGreatWayToJudgeChampions
You realize lolking is a thing right.... and it says what mode you play in.... RIGHT!?
You played literally a single bot game... WELP! Although I will say its a great example of how stubborn you are. XDDDDDD it gave me a few giggles.

Yeah, I'm not going to ruin nine people's day because I want to suffer through a Cassiopeia game.

And for the record, this is the first bot game I've played since they butchered her where I couldn't get max stacks before it ended. Man, having less agency over that shitty passive was **so great** let me tell you.

The passive honestly doesnt even matter anymore.... its literally the cherry on top rather than the focus...... LIKE SERIOUSLY! SHE IS NOT THE SAME CHAMPION SHE WAS WHEN SHE WAS ORIGINALLY REWORKED. Stop being such a damn brick wall and play the damn champ.

Don't get me wrong though. The passive is nice, but really its not even that important. If you get stacks cool, if not THATS ALSO COOL! You don't need it to function anymore. Max Q btw, don't max E. You get more damage out of maxing Q now due to the poison debuff.

The current passive is trash. It's not nice. Let's get that clear right now.

The problem with the passive has two sides: gameplay and identity. 

Cassiopeia is **not** an evolving champion. You don't **embrace** curses, especially when their effect has already taken its complete toll. *The idea of the passive is not only already done, it doesn't fit here.*

Gameplay-wise, the passive sucks because the rewards it gives you aren't tantalizing. You can get 30% bonus AP from Rabadon's. You can get 25% CDR easily, and having it forced on you actually limits your itemization. And the on-hit heal is just pseudo-spell vamp. Nothing the passive gives you is *actually interesting*, just regurgitated stats.

Oh. And thanks for saying she's not the same champion as before the rework. **Because that's actually the biggest problem with it. The fact this is the case is a huge breach of what a rework is meant to be.**

If Aspect is the "cherry on top", your cherry is rotten.

> [{quoted}](name=IndyBoy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WPsf4IHw,comment-id=0001000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-13T02:43:14.560+0000)
>SHE IS NOT THE SAME CHAMPION SHE WAS WHEN SHE WAS ORIGINALLY REWORKED. 

FUCKING... IM SAYING, WHEN SHE WAS FIRST REWORKED, SHE WAS GARBAGE, HER PASSIVE FELT LIKE SHIT, THE CHAMPION FELT LIKE SHIT, EVERYTHING FELT LIKE SHIT. IM FUCKING SAYING SHE ISNT LIKE THAT ANYMORE READ WHAT I FUCKING TYPE BEFORE JUST ASSUMING.

In fact she feels very VERY close to what she did pre rework but with less dmg on her W and more dmg on making combos with her E and Q.

Also the passive is irrelevant, she doesn't even need it to fucntion anymore do you even read? Like literally you could not even have a passive as Cass anymore and the champion would still be playable. It literally is nothing more than a bonus now. A bonus bit of stats that you don't even have to think about anymore, it literally just happens. TRY.... PLAYING... THE CHAMPION. HOLY SHIT!

If that's really what you felt about pre-rework Cassiopeia, you legitimately stupid.

No way around that. If you think balls of stats are nice, and Riot wants to continue to cater to low caliber players who enjoy that sort of shit this is a game I don't really think it worth playing anymore.

This is my impression of you:

"I'M GOOD AT COMMUNICATING, YOU JUST SUCK AT LISTENING."

Try harder, Indy**Boy**.

Yes. Start with telling me I'm rude, then use the next two paragraphs to childishly insult me.

Perfect.

I'm done. You are very rude and you don't really care what I have to say anyway and to be honest no you're not good at listening. Not even slightly. Considering the fact that I had to literally spell out what I was saying in the dumbest way possible for you to actually understand(say's a lot about your listening skills), and then once I feel you actually understood, you didn't even address my points. I mean how hard is it to understand which Cassiopeia I'm talking about when I say the reworked Cass? *shrug* I don't have time to waste yelling at brick walls like you, who think they know how much a champ has changed after they've been updated without actually playing her in a real game. Have fun wallowing in self pity and anger for eternity. Peace.(final response)

P.S. You should get a few pretzels to go with all that salt you got going there. Or maybe some french fries? Oh I know some onion rings, everybody loves those! Seriously though, your sodium level is unreal.

The one I have been comparing this recent update of cass to is POST... REWORK..... CASSSSSSSSSSSSSS. PLEASE FREAKING RE-READ EVERYTHING THAT I JUST TYPED WITH THAT IN YOUR MIND.

I freaking loved the original Cass I hated everything about the rework, then they just updated her and I swear to you, she feels 10 million times better...... Just give her a freaking chance man.

Maxing Q gives you wave clear just like old Cass. No more monotonous farming for stacks. YOU CAN KILL YOUR OPPONENT LVL 2 IN LANE EASILY. Your new damge is huge man, just freaking try it.

NOOOOOOOOOOOOOO YOU ARE NOT UNDERSTANDING THE WORDS I AM TYPING.

PRE-REWORK CASS=GOOD CHAMPION

POST-REWORK CASS=BAD CHAMPION

THERE. I SPELLED IT OUT TO YOU IN BLACK AND WHITE SO YOU COULD UNDERSTAND IT.

I can get behind some of the changes, but rather than Q and E losing their cast animations, it should just be one of them instead.


Asides from that, maybe her E's mana cost shouldn't hike so sharply with level.


Beyond that, I'd prefer a full on paradigm change or atleast the god damn option to play her as a Poison Mage rather than Rambo with boobs.

Yeah, the more I play it the more I feel like AT LEAST one of them is necessary, maybe both. Also as much as I want old Cass back, and I do, I just don't see him changing it friend. :( Like.... I LOVE OLD CASS... a lot. I've been playing a bunch of new updated Cass, last game I did over 71,000 dmg to champions. But like I don't know how I feel about it. Like Its alright I guess, its cohesive, dealing damage like that is fun. I feel like some QoL improvements would be amazing. Allow her to carry harder, kite better, allow more cool plays. But I honestly couldn't tell you how I would feel about her after those QoL changes were applied. Maybe I would feel like she was amazing, maybe I would feel the same. I have no clue. i don't know if I could ever love her as much as old Cass.

That's actually not too impressive for an AP mid, and the old one could do it too. Only a bit more spread out. That is...unless you mean you did all that damage in a single battle, in which case...yeah that's pretty high if a little hard to believe.


While the old Cass also needed to make use of her E as well, it's prominence was drastically lower, her Q and W did substantial damage too, and more importantly to multiple targets.



Or to put it another way...she was well balanced and actually satisfying.



And as I've mentioned multiple times in the past. People are mistaking VIABILITY (or even OP) for FUN and thematic consistency. The most I can do is make some noise and TRY to add a little REASON into their mind. But yeah it's pretty futile, better than not trying atleast.

That was 1 game.(if thats what you mean by a single battle) In 1 game I did approximately 72 k dmg to champions(and almost 275k dmg total.) Higher than both ADC's. We still lost mind you but its whatever. I'm still trying to learn this new Cass. But like, I understand what you're saying about Viable vs Fun but I have to say, I am having fun. Now am I having as much fun as old Cass? Iunno, but this Cass is definitely starting to grow on me the more I play her.

Like lol, a rengar jumped on me last game and I stoned him and killed him before he could do basically anything because I hit so damn hard.

But again, I see where you're coming from in terms of the playstyle change. It kinda sucks but like, just play her a bit, she feels A LOT more fun than she did before the recent update. Like shes not old Cass but I must admit, I'm enjoying her.

All I really really think she needs, in all honesty, are the QoL fixes and I could totes see her played in the LCS. Also I think she'd be super duper more fun. :3

There is a distinction to make of course.


That Rengar situation you described could have been done even with old Cassiopeia. Probably not nearly as effectively, but at the same time...why the heck is a Poison Mage so focused on being a duelist rather than performing cowardly hit and run tactics with her biological warfare?

Here's a thought. Cobras strike hard and they strike fast. Thair fangs are enormous. They kill with precision and venom injected from their fangs. I would type more but I'm in game atm. Just play her some dude.

Oh also I just wanna say, my science teacher a long time ago taught me something(yay learning). Theres a difference between poison and venom. Poison is a substance that if CONSUMED can kill you. Venom is injected directly into the bloodstream through fangs. Snakes don't have poison, they have venom. Yay science.

Yeah I knew that. And more specifically, Venom is more of an enzyme. However tooltips, buff indicators, etc. all say Poison hence why I say Poison. That and...if you look at Cassiopeia's spells, they really are more Poison than they are Venom aren't they? Is she doing any injecting at all? It looks more like she is making the enemy inhale her gas.


Here's a fun fact, wanna know what game/company got the distinction between POISON and VENOM better than Riot did? [Yu-Gi-Oh!](http://yugioh.wikia.com/wiki/Venom) 

Building up on my Yugioh mention.

[This is Stashu's Cassiopeia](http://yugioh.wikia.com/wiki/Vennominon_the_King_of_Poisonous_Snakes)

[This is what Cassiopeia should be](http://yugioh.wikia.com/wiki/Vennominaga_the_Deity_of_Poisonous_Snakes)

**TL;DR **- Cassiopeia turned Cassiopeia into a dude

> science teacher a long time ago taught me **something(yay learning)**

You see, this is why you put a space before a bracket, because I momentarily read "gay learning" XD

>Vennominaga

Heh, she's actually the reason why I developed an interest for the whole snakelady theme. Seeing Cassiopeia in the roster of this game was exactly the motivation I needed to start playing LoL. It's too bad she's not even remotely as powerful as the snake deity is.

I've played her a few times. I have a hard time justifying playing her more though (or any LoL atm). For one thing...Finals. I've barely played at all lately, if I do it's often to kick back to fight the monotony of studying and getting that first win IP. I've played the new Cass a number of times, enough to give feedback and critiques. I'll probably give her one more shot or two after the Finals are over, but considering how little I'm enjoying her, it'll literally be for the sake of providing feedback. However even THAT is harder than it sounds. Play blind-pick and I have to fight over who gets to mid and see who locks their champion in first. Use the Team-Builder and wait half an hour before a game can even begin. Worse of all...you get ZERO data if you end up in a mirror match making that wait all for naught. I guess I could try Ranked games out...but I'm not about to put my MMR on the line just to test her out for kinks and feels.



In the end as I look at the bigger picture I wonder...whether you like her new rework or not, there is no denying she was horribly thought out and rushed through with little thought upon release. What the heck was up with that?


**PS** - most poisonous snakes don't bite very hard, and they don't engage in much "fights"...unless they're up against a mongoose. In which case they lose more-often than not, making mongoose a **great** source of pest control in areas with snake problems. Unless you're a non-venomous large snake who kills by crushing their preys (in which case, you'll challenge even **elephants**), most snakes prefers to either prey on animals far smaller than them or take a nip and run away...


**edit:** I swear to a god which I don't believe in that this post started off like...a 3 sentence post. But I just kept adding shit in.

lolol its fine dude. Also I've never waited longer than 10 minutes for a team builder game most of the time, its all I play. Oh and right now with the new champion release mid lane mages are a hot commodity, so my advice it to get in on it if you can. I get put in a lobby after like 5 seconds and I can be picky who I want to play with. Its great :D

Oh and the reason I compare her to a Cobra and not to any other snake is because of her appearance. She has the head piece that resembles a cobra.

Getting into a lobby is easy.

It's waiting for a jerk-off to 

1) enter the lobby with the appropriate role

and

2) stay longer than 5 seconds...or atleast long enough for the final spot to be filled in

ergh the lobby can be a nightmare.


> Oh and the reason I compare her to a Cobra and not to any other snake is because of her appearance. She has the head piece that resembles a cobra.

Ah...well...in that case fine. I just saw her as a generically themed lamia...

Most venomous creatures strike fast, yes. And then they retreat to let the venom run its course.

Cobras are a good example of that. 

There's so much resource investment in developing a venom that risking harm by attacking again directly after using their venom is a bad idea because the prey wouldn't be weak enough to not cause them injury.

The Cass rework is sort of the same way. She "uses" poisons really badly, since they only set up her 'get close and repeatedly bite" [now] sole method of damage.

> [{quoted}](name=IndyBoy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WPsf4IHw,comment-id=000100000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-13T03:08:22.989+0000)
> FUCKING... IM SAYING, WHEN SHE WAS FIRST REWORKED, SHE WAS GARBAGE, HER PASSIVE FELT LIKE SHIT, THE CHAMPION FELT LIKE SHIT, EVERYTHING FELT LIKE SHIT.


Yet you "LOVE OLD CASS".

Oh my lord.... I'm saying...................... now please listen.................... When she was first reworked.................. and they shifted her damage from q to e............. and they changed her passive to the stacking passive.................... the stacking e based cassiopeia was trash, it was awful, the stacking mechanic felt awful, the e based damage felt awful EVERYTHING ABOUT THE NEW REWORKED CASS WAS AWFUL...............................I AM NOT REFERRING TO PRE-REWORK CASSIOPEIA.

I.............LOVED..............PRE-REWORK CASSIOPEIA.... LITERALLY EVERYTHING ABOUT HER I LOVED

I REPEAT THE POST-REWORK CASSIOPEIA IS THE ONE I AM TALKING ABOUT WHEN I SAY SHE WAS GARBAGE.

Since the update the new post rework Cassiopeia does not feel so shitty, she feels very reminiscent of the original Cass PRE-REWORK CASS. If that isn't clear enough for you then I have lost all hope in humanity.

they almost entirely reverted the rework except of her passive, more responsive E and healtheir early game Q spam...

the only things I would agree on is her attack animation, which isn't a big deal anyway since you last hitting with E, mostly, and particle effects for clarity. 
All the others are there for the sake of balance, removing the cast time from E is like removing cast time from an auto attack.....can you even imagine it ?
removing the cast time from Q ? where's the counter play than? they gave it a delay for a reason.... 
I can't comment really on her W...but it doesn't bother me tbh, cass in amazing spot right now
I'm not talk about cast time I'm talking about being able to continue your movement while casting these abilities. There's a big difference between the 2.

> [{quoted}](name=IndyBoy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WPsf4IHw,comment-id=0002000000010000,timestamp=2014-12-12T16:54:46.565+0000)
> I'm not talk about cast time I'm talking about being able to continue your movement while casting these abilities. There's a big difference between the 2.

You're talking about cast times.

Syndra has transient casting times. This means she can move while casting.

Cassiopeia does not. This means she has to stay still while casting.

Yes but the time it takes to cast the ability remains the same.... also Cass's abilities are not auto attacks. She has to do more to get her pay off. As in she has to land a skillshot, then pay mana to cast her E, which is on a timer. Its not that much to ask to be able to move while casting E or Q. Look the point is its just a suggestion. Something you can TEST on PBE. If it turns out to be OP then they don't have to add it. :/

I think being able to cast Q while moving would be better than E, because hey ad carries too have to stop and shoot.
That being said, I don't think anything should have higher priority right now than changing her passive to something completely different.

Stashu has already commented on a question of mine regarding Movement while casting (I cant seem to find it tho, maybe it wasnt Stashu). To paraphrase he has discussed this with the design team, but felt it better to leave the cast times.

AA animation: I have suggested this as well, have you played with Syndra? holy shit that AA is *smoooooth*. The "pro's" put 2 to 4 points in the AS mastery instead of CDR. Ive been trying it and it really does help, even just a little.

Her cast-time shouldn't be canceled, just shortened perhaps (when you R someone you don't want to waste half that 2 seconds CC casting Q and W on your enemies). The E could use some "interruptability" like autoattack animations do
Plus, may I say, I'd bring back the scaling Q movement speed buff (the old Cass one, not the pre-4.21; 15 / 17.5 / 20 / 22.5 / 25 %).

IndyBoy said:

Pre-rework (re: most of 2014) Cass - Great

Post rework (re: when it was first done) Cass - Bad

Live Cass (one with 500 stack cap passive that doesn't stack with minion kills) - Great

And tbh it's hard to misunderstand that and Serpents Embrace did not.

What IndyBoy used to say that live cass was great, however, was that 'her Q is great at waveclear and bullying'.

Serpents Embrace responded with the __fact__ (and check the numbers if you don't believe me) that old Cass (pre-any-rework) did it better.

And IndyBoy did not understand that that is what Serpents Embrace wrote, from what I can tell.

btw... you.... don't..... ever need.... to write.... like THIS....

NOR DO YOU EVER NEED

TO DO WRITING LIKE THIS

IT LOOKS LIKE YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND HOW ENGLISH WORKS

And, tbh, most people don't, but also true is that language (and writing, therefore) is for communication. Doing this makes it actively more difficult for your readers to see what you've written, and therefore eliminating a big chunk of the why behind writing.

Being clear is above all else when it comes to making a point is all, and writing as demonstrated above makes the meaning obfuscated.

I had said that maxing Q allowed for better wave clear and that it was now viable to do so since it gave you more damage with the combo between that and your E rather than maxing your E, which the previous post-rework Cass forced you to do. That is not to say that Q in itself is now good for bullying, but rather it allows her to now bully her opponent with the new changes implemented. This is important because it allows you to have both damage and wave clear which the previous iteration of the post reworked Cassiopeia did not have. I then went on to make the point that the new Cass now had enough damage to Kill her lane opponent at level 2, which the original post-rework Cass could not do.

Also you are correct, I probably did not have to type in all bold or to space my words out as I did. But its kind of difficult to remain calm when someone is constantly misunderstanding my words, calling my opinions dumb and acting incredibly high and mighty rather then asking "did you mean pre-rework Cass or post-rework Cass when you said this..."

So should I have stayed more calm and collected and articulated my words better? Yes. Should he have understood what I was saying after the third time? Probably. Is that any excuse for me going off? No.

P.S. Its kind of hard to have a discussion with someone who acts like they understand how a champion has been affected by changes when they themselves have not even played the champion. Serpents Embrace never, EVEN ONCE, played the new updated Cass against actual players yet he claimed to be all knowing about how she now functioned and played. Its very frustrating trying to talk with someone like that, not to mention the fact that he consistently was miss-interpreting what I was saying and making incredibly wild accusations about my opinions as if he was basically ignoring what I was writing. This lead me to become even more frustrated. So in short, he needs to read better, I need to type more clearly in the beginning. We're both at fault but at least I'm man enough to admit it.

> [{quoted}](name=IndyBoy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WPsf4IHw,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2014-12-13T20:43:14.665+0000)
> I had said that maxing Q allowed for better wave clear and that it was now viable

To explain: Serpents Embrace believes this to be false (the viable part)

> to do so since it gave you more damage with the combo between that and your E rather than maxing your E, which the previous post-rework Cass forced you to do. 

Definitely agree here, and that changing to a force-max E was bad for Cassio.

> That is not to say that Q in itself is now good for bullying, but rather it allows her to now bully her opponent with the new changes implemented. 

Hmm, not sure what to think here myself. I have never played Cassiopeia since her update myself, but the two Cassiopeia's I met were struggling even with the new changes to avoid dying. Heck, one of them was feeding their lane... in Intermediate Bots.

>This is important because it allows you to have both damage and wave clear which the previous iteration of the post reworked Cassiopeia did not have. 

I disagree with this because Cassiopeia still has to both poison and then proceed to spam Twin Fang on creeps in order to actually get rid of them, but most other mages can clear waves while spending less mana.

>I then went on to make the point that the new Cass now had enough damage to Kill her lane opponent at level 2, which the original post-rework Cass could not do.

Right.

> Also you are correct, I probably did not have to type in all bold or to space my words out as I did. But its kind of difficult to remain calm when someone is constantly misunderstanding my words, calling my opinions dumb and acting incredibly high and mighty rather then asking "did you mean pre-rework Cass or post-rework Cass when you said this..."

Staying calm is important. If you can't stay calm when writing your piece, either say so (e.g. give yourself a margin of "I'm human please don't treat me like I'm perfect"), or don't post. I do this (frequently I actually write a reply and just never post it \>\ P.S. Its kind of hard to have a discussion with someone who acts like they understand how a champion has been affected by changes when they themselves have not even played the champion. Serpents Embrace never, EVEN ONCE, played the new updated Cass against actual players yet he claimed to be all knowing about how she now functioned and played. 

This is false because 1) PBE 2) Smurfs 3) Friend experiences 4) Videos. You do NOT need to have played a Champion in order to know how they function, you need to watch it be played OR play it yourself. The latter gives a better view, but both give you information-- and lots of it.

>Its very frustrating trying to talk with someone like that, not to mention the fact that he consistently was miss-interpreting what I was saying and making incredibly wild accusations about my opinions as if he was basically ignoring what I was writing. This lead me to become even more frustrated. 

**Eh**. "If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say it at all" is something that everybody needs to learn (both you and Serpents Embrace have been awfully cruel to one another from what I can tell).

But you both treated the other like they were idiots :<

>So in short, he needs to read better, I need to type more clearly in the beginning. We're both at fault but at least I'm man enough to admit it.

These. Sentences. Prove, without other context, that you are not 'man enough', because you are still pushing blame onto others. How do you know Serpents Embrace wasn't being jovial and merely messing with you, playing devil's advocate for your argument?

Short: You don't.

Hence, why would you say this? Just admit your own faults, don't push any onto others. If you only admit your own faults, it makes you seem stronger as a character, and people tend to be decent judges of character and tend to agree with people who have characters that they individually agree or sympathize with.

A better way to say that you're "man enough to admit it" would have been

>#In short, I need to type more clearly-- and I'm man enough to admit to that.

Nothing else. No incrimination besides the implied, which can be refuted only by the other party admitting their own guilt.

-
Ugh I love having headaches [/sarcasm]
I've lost myself with this wall, so hopefully I don't need to go and edit it.
Cass still needs a lot more than simple 'balance' and 'QoL' changes.

hmm.. okay so the new Cass is really strong. Do you think these changes could push her over the top?

Also, will she be nerfed soon? Makes me a little sad if it comes to this

"Will she be nerfed soon?" Your guess is as good as mine friend. xD
She is pretty good now, OP? Ehhhhhh I'm not sure, she just got changed, I feel like we need AT LEAST 2 weeks to say for sure. 

Will these push her over the edge..... hmmmmm. The auto attack animation and the poison indicator no. they are minor changes that don't really have THAT much influence but they would be nice little changes to make her feel more fluent.

Now the mobility changes to Q and E.... I have no idea, I feel like that would be something that should at least be tested in beta. If it turns out it pushes her over the top then no. But if they don't then why the hell not. Cass could use a small change to her mobility, and the PBE and internal test are perfect for testing this kind of stuff because it doesn't necessarily mean it would go live.

Also to be honest I think I would trade a bit of damage on new Cass for the small mobility buffs. It would make her feel sooooooo muchhhhh betterrrrrrrrrrrr.
